The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “We bow to you who command the force of leadership and the ten powers! We bow to you who are dauntless, knowing no fear!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: dharmeṣu āveṇikaniścayaṃ gataṃ vandāmi tvāṃ sarvajagatpraṇāyakam // //
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: We bow to you, leader of all living beings, Who fully manifests the special qualities!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: vandāmi samyojanabandhanacchidaṃ vandāmi tvāṃ pāragataṃ sthale sthitam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “We bow to you who have cut the bondage of all fetters! We bow to you who, having gone beyond, stand on firm ground!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: vandāmi khinnasya janasya tārakaṃ vandāmi saṃsāragatāv aniśritam // //
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: We bow to you who save the suffering beings! We bow to you who do not remain in the migrations!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: satvair samādhānagataṃ gatīgatam gatīṣu sarvāsu vimuktamānasam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “You associate with living beings by frequenting their migrations, Yet your mind is liberated from all migrations.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: jaleruhaṃ vā salile na lipyase niṣevitā te munipadma śūnyatā // //
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Just as the lotus, born of mud, is not tainted thereby,

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: vibhāvitā sarvanimitta sarvaśo na te kahiṃcit praṇidhāna vidyate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “You nullify all signs in all things everywhere. You are not subject to any wish for anything at all.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: acintiyaṃ buddhamahānubhāvaṃ vande 'ham ākāśasamam aniśritam // //
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The miraculous power of the buddhas is inconceivable. We bow to you, who stand nowhere, like infinite space.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  atha ratnākaro licchavikumāro bhagavantam ābhir gāthābhir abhiṣṭutya bhagavantam etad avocat imāni bhagavan pañcamātrāṇi licchavikumāraśatāni sarvāṇy anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāni / tāni cemāni buddhakṣetrapariśuddhiṃ paripṛcchanti ḥ katamā bodhisatvānāṃ buddhakṣetrapariśuddhir iti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Then, the young Licchavi Ratnākara, having celebrated the Buddha with these verses, further addressed him, “Lord, these five hundred young Licchavis are truly on their way to unexcelled, perfect enlightenment, and they have asked what is the bodhisattvas’ purification of the buddhafield. Please, Lord, explain to them the bodhisattvas’ purification of the buddhafield!”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: evam ukte bhagavān ratnākarāya licchavikumārāya sādhukāram adāt
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Upon this request, the Buddha gave his approval to the young Licchavi Ratnākara.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sādhu sādhu kumāra /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Good, good, young man!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sādhu khalu punas tvaṃ kumāra yas tvaṃ buddhakṣetrapariśuddhim ārabhya tathāgataṃ paripṛcchasi /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Your question to the Tathāgata about the purification of the buddhafield is indeed good.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tena hi kumāra śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Therefore, young man, listen well and remember!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: bhāṣiṣye 'haṃ te yathā bodhisatvānāṃ buddhakṣetrapariśuddhim ārabhya /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: I will explain to you the purification of the buddhafield of the bodhisattvas.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sādhu bhagavann iti ratnākaro licchavikumāras tāni ca pañcamātrāṇi licchavikumāraśatāni bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣuḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Very good, Lord,” replied Ratnākara and the five hundred young Licchavis, and they set themselves to listen.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: bhagavāṃs teṣām etad avocat Vkn  satvakṣetraṃ kulaputra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha said, “Noble son, a buddhafield of bodhisattvas is a field of living beings.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tat kasya hetoḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Why so?

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yāvantaṃ bodhisatvaḥ satveṣūpacayaṃ karoti tāvad buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhṇāti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: A bodhisattva embraces a buddhafield to the same extent that he causes the development of living beings.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yādṛśaḥ satvānāṃ vinayo bhavati tādṛśaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhnāti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He embraces a buddhafield to the same extent that living beings become disciplined.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yādṛśena buddhakṣetrāvatāreṇa satvā buddhajñānam avataranti tādṛśaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhnāti / yādṛśena buddhakṣetrāvatāreṇa satvānām āryākārāṇīndriyāṇy utpadyante tādṛśaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhṇāti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He embraces a buddhafield to the same extent that, through entrance into a buddhafield, living beings are introduced to the buddhagnosis. He embraces a buddhafield to the same extent that, through entrance into that buddhafield, living beings increase their noble spiritual faculties.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tat kasya hetoḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Why so?

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: satvārthanirjātaṃ hi kulaputra bodhisatvānāṃ buddhakṣetram /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: ‌Noble son, a buddhafield of bodhisattvas springs from the aims of living beings.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tadyathā ratnākara yādṛśam icched ākāśaṃ māpayituṃ tādṛśaṃ māpayeta, na cākāśaṃ śakyate māpayituṃ nāpy alaṃkartum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “For example, Ratnākara, should one wish to build in empty space, one might go ahead in spite of the fact that it is not possible to build or to adorn anything in empty space.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: evam eva ratnākara ākāśasamān sarvadharmāñ jñātvā / yādṛśam icched bodhisatvaḥ satvaparipākāya buddhakṣetraṃ māpayituṃ tādṛśaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ māpayati, na ca buddhakṣetrākāśatā śakyaṃ māpayituṃ nāpy alaṃkartum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: In just the same way, should a bodhisattva, who knows full well that all things are like empty space, wish to build a buddhafield in order to develop living beings, he might go ahead, in spite of the fact that it is not possible to build or to adorn a buddhafield in empty space.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  api ca ratnākara, āśayakṣetraṃ bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Yet, Ratnākara, a bodhisattva’s buddhafield is a field of positive thought.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasyāśaṭhā amāyāvinaḥ satvā buddhakṣetra upapadyante /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings free of hypocrisy and deceit will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: adhyāśayakṣetraṃ kulaputra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “‌Noble son, a bodhisattva’s buddhafield is a field of high resolve.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvakuśalasaṃbhāropacitāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings who have harvested the two stores and have planted the roots of virtue will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: prayogakṣetraṃ bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is a field of virtuous application.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvakuśaladharmopasthitāḥ satvās tatra buddhakṣetra upapadyante /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings who live by all virtuous principles will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: udāro bodhisatvasya bodhicittotpādo buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is the magnificence of the conception of the spirit of enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya mahāyānasaṃprasthitāḥ satvās tatra buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings who are actually participating in the Mahāyāna will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: dānakṣetraṃ bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is a field of generosity.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvaparityāginaḥ satvās tatra buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings who give away all their possessions will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: śīlakṣetraṃ bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is a field of morality.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvābhiprāyasaṃpannā daśakuśalakarmapathasaṃrakṣakāḥ satvās tatra buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings who follow the path of the ten virtues with positive thoughts will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: kṣāntikṣetraṃ kulaputra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is a field of tolerance.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya dvātriṃśallakṣanālaṃkṛtāḥ kṣāntidamaśamathapāramiprāptāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings with the transcendences of tolerance, discipline, and the superior trancehence beautiful with the thirtytwo auspicious signswill be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: vīryakṣetraṃ bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is a field of effort.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvakuśalaparyeṣṭiṣv ārabdhavīryāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings who devote their efforts to virtue will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: dhyānakṣetraṃ bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is a field of meditation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya smṛtisaṃprajanyasamāhitāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings who are evenly balanced through mindfulness and awareness will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: prajñākṣetraṃ bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is a field of wisdom.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya samyaktvaniyatāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings who are destined for the ultimate will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: catvāry apramāṇāni ca bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield consists of the four immeasurables.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya maitrīkaruṇāmuditopekṣāvihārinaḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings who live by love, compassion, joy, and impartiality will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: catvāri saṃgrahavastūni kulaputra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield consists of the four means of unification.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvavimuktisaṃgṛhītāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings who are held together by all the liberations will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: upāyakauśalyaṃ bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is skill in liberative art.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvopāyamīmāṃsākuśalāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings skilled in all liberative arts and activities will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣā dharmā bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield consists of the thirtyseven aids to enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya samyaksmṛtyupasthānasamyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgavidhijñāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Living beings who devote their efforts to the four foci of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of magical power, the five spiritual faculties, the five strengths, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the eight branches of the holy path will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: pariṇāmanācittaṃ bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is his mind of total dedication.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvaguṇālaṃkāraṃ buddhakṣetraṃ dṛśyate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, the ornaments of all virtues will appear in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: aṣṭākṣaṇapraśamadeśanā kulaputra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is the doctrine that eradicates the eight adversities.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvāpāyasamucchinnam aṣṭākṣaṇavigataṃ buddhakṣetraṃ saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, the three bad migrations will cease, and there will be no such thing as the eight adversities in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: svayaṃ śikṣāpadeṣu vartamānā parāpattyacodanatā bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield consists of his personal observance of the basic precepts and his restraint in blaming others for their transgressions.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasyāpattiśabdo 'pi buddhakṣetre na saṃbhavati /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, even the word ‘crime’ will never be mentioned in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: daśakuśalakarmapathapariśuddhiḥ kulaputra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “A bodhisattva’s buddhafield is the purity of the path of the ten virtues.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bodhiprāptasya niyatāyuṣo mahābhogā brahmacāriṇaḥ satyānuparivartinyā vācālaṃkṛtā madhuravacanā abhinnaparṣado bhinnasaṃdhānakuśalā īrṣyāvigatā avyāpannacittāḥ samyagdṛṣṭisamanvāgatāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When he attains enlightenment, living beings who are secure in long life, great in wealth, chaste in conduct, enhanced by true speech, softspoken, free of divisive intrigues and adroit in reconciling factions, enlightening in their conversations, free of envy, free of malice, and endowed with perfect views will be born in his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  iti hi kulaputra, yāvanto bodhisatvasya prayogās tāvanta āśayāḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Thus, noble son, just as is the bodhisattva’s production of the spirit of enlightenment, so is his positive thought.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yāvanta āśayās tāvanto 'dhyāśayāḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: And just as is his positive thought, so is his virtuous application.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yāvanto 'dhyāśayās tāvantyo nidhyaptayaḥ / yāvantyo nidhyaptayas tāvantyaḥ pratipattayaḥ / yāvantyaḥ pratipattayas tāvantyaḥ pariṇāmanāḥ / yāvantyaḥ pariṇāmanās tāvanta upāyāḥ / yāvanta upāyās tāvantyaḥ kṣetrapariśuddhayaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “His virtuous application is tantamount to his high resolve his high resolve is tantamount to his determination his determination is tantamount to his practice his practice is tantamount to his total dedication his total dedication is tantamount to his liberative art his liberative art is tantamount to his development of living beings and his development of living beings is tantamount to the purity of his buddhafield.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yādṛśī kṣetrapariśuddhis tādṛśī satvapariśuddhiḥ / yādṛśī satvapariśuddhis tādṛśī jñānapariśuddhiḥ / yādṛśī jñānapariśuddhis tādṛśī deśanāpariśuddhiḥ / yādṛśī deśanāpariśuddhis tādṛśī jñānapratipattipariśuddhiḥ / yādṛśī jñānapratipattipariśuddhis tādṛśī svacittapariśuddhiḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “The purity of his buddhafield reflects the purity of living beings the purity of the living beings reflects the purity of his gnosis the purity of his gnosis reflects the purity of his doctrine the purity of his doctrine reflects the purity of his transcendental practice and the purity of his transcendental practice reflects the purity of his own mind.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  atha buddhānubhāvenāyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasyaitad abhavat
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Thereupon, magically influenced by the Buddha, the venerable Śāriputra had this thought

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yadi yādṛśī cittapariśuddhis tādṛśī bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetrapariśuddhiḥ saṃbhavati, tan mā āhaiva bhagavataḥ śākyamuner bodhisatvacaryāṃ carataś cittam apariśuddhaṃ yenedaṃ buddhakṣetram evam apariśuddhaṃ saṃdṛśyate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “If the buddhafield is pure only to the extent that the mind of the bodhisattva is pure, then, when Śākyamuni Buddha was engaged in the career of the bodhisattva, his mind must have been impure. Otherwise, how could this buddhafield appear to be so impure?”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkam ājñāyāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram etad avocat
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha, aware of venerable Śāriputra’s thoughts, said to him, “What do you think, Śāriputra?

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: śāriputra mā āhaiva sūryācandramasāv apariśuddhau yaj jātyandho na paśyati /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Is it because the sun and moon are impure that those blind from birth do not see them?” Śāriputra replied, “No, Lord.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: āha no hīdaṃ bhagavan jātyandhāparādha eṣa na sūryacandramasoḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is not so. The fault lies with those blind from birth, and not with the sun and moon.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: āha evam eva śāriputra satvānām ajñānāparādha eṣa yas tathāgatasya buddhakṣetraguṇālaṃkāravyūhaṃ kecit satvā na paśyanti,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha declared, “In the same way, Śāriputra, the fact that some living beings do not behold the splendid display of virtues of the buddhafield of the Tathāgata is due to their own ignorance.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: na tatra tathāgatasyāparādhaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is not the fault of the Tathāgata.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: pariśuddhaṃ hi śāriputra tathāgatasya buddhakṣetraṃ yūyaṃ punar idaṃ na paśyatha /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Śāriputra, the buddhafield of the Tathāgata is pure, but you do not see it.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  atha khalu jaṭī brahmā sthaviraṃ śāriputram etad avocat mā bhadantaśāriputra tathāgatasyāpariśuddhaṃ buddhakṣetram idaṃ vyāhārṣīt /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Then, the Brahmā Śikhin said to the venerable Śāriputra, “Reverend Śāriputra, do not say that the buddhafield of the Tathāgata is impure.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: pariśuddhaṃ hi bhadantaśāriputra bhagavato buddhakṣetram /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Reverend Śāriputra, the buddhafield of the Tathāgata is pure.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: īdṛśān vayaṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ paśyāmaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: I see the splendid expanse of the buddhafield of the Lord Śākyamuni as equal to the splendor of, for example, the abodes of the highest deities.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: atha khalu sthaviraḥ śāriputro jaṭinaṃ brahmāṇam etad avocat vayaṃ punar brahmann imāṃ mahāpṛthivīm utkūlanikūlāṃ kaṇṭakaprapātagiriśekharaśvabhragūthoḍigallapratipūrṇāṃ paśyāmaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Brahmā Śikhin, “As for me, O Brahmā, I see this great earth, with its highs and lows, its thorns, its precipices, its peaks, and its abysses, as if it were entirely filled with ordure.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: nūnaṃ bhadantaśāriputrasyotkūlanikūlaṃ cittam apariśuddhabuddhajñānāśayaṃ yenedṛśaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ paśyasi /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Brahmā Śikhin replied, “The fact that you see such a buddhafield as this as if it were so impure, reverend Śāriputra, is a sure sign that there are highs and lows in your mind and that your positive thought in regard to the buddhagnosis is not pure either.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ye punas te bhadantaśāriputra bodhisatvāḥ sarvasatvasamacittāḥ pariśuddhabuddhajñānāśayās ta imaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pariśuddhaṃ paśyanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Reverend Śāriputra, those whose minds are impartial toward all living beings and whose positive thoughts toward the buddhagnosis are pure see this buddhafield as perfectly pure.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  asmin khalu punar buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhālaṃkāre saṃdarśyamāne caturaśīteḥ prāṇisahasrāṇām anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpannāni yāni ca tāni ratnākareṇa licchavikumāreṇa sārdhaṃ pañca licchavikumāraśatāny āgatāni teṣām apy ānulomikyāḥ kṣānteḥ pratilaṃbho 'bhūt /

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  atha bhagavān punar eva tām ṛddhiṃ pratisaṃharati sma / tataḥ punar evedaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ tatsvabhāvam eva saṃvṛtam,

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He had a son, a wife, and female attendants, yet always maintained continence.

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He appeared to be adorned with ornaments, yet always was endowed with the auspicious signs and marks.

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He seemed to eat and drink, yet always took nourishment from the taste of meditation.

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He mixed in all crowds, yet was respected as foremost of all.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  dharmavādī ca vṛddhamadhyadahrasahāyakaś ca lokānuvartanāya / sarvavyavahārodyuktaś ca na ca lābhabhogābhilāṣī /

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: To educate living beings, he would appear at crossroads and on street corners, and to protect them he participated in government.

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: To turn people away from the Individual Vehicle and to engage them in the Mahāyāna, he appeared among listeners and teachers of the Dharma.

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: To develop children, he visited all the schools.

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: To demonstrate the evils of desire, he even entered the brothels.

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He was honored as the landlord among landlords because he renounced the aggressiveness of ownership. He was honored as the warrior among warriors because he cultivated endurance, determination, and fortitude.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: brāhmaṇeṣu ca brāhmaṇasaṃmato mānamadadarpanirghātanāya /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He was honored as the brahmin among brahmins because he suppressed pride, vanity, and arrogance.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: āmātyeṣu cāmātyasaṃmataḥ sarvarājakāryasahadharmamyojanāya /

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He was honored as the prince of princes because he reversed their attachment to royal pleasures and sovereign power. He was honored as a chamberlain in the royal harem because he brought the young ladies to spiritual maturity.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  prākṛtajanānuvartakaś ca sāmānyapuṇyaviśiṣṭādhyālaṃbanāya /

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: lokapāleṣu ca lokapālasaṃmataḥ sarvasatvaparipālanāya /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He was honored as the Lokapāla among Lokapālas because he fostered the development of all living beings.

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When they arrived, Vimalakīrti taught them the Dharma, beginning his discourse from the actuality of the four main elements

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: evam anityo 'yaṃ mārṣāḥ kāyaḥ / evam adhruvaḥ,

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: This body is like a ball of foam, unable to bear any pressure. It is like a water bubble, not remaining very long. It is like a mirage, born from the appetites of the passions.

The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is like the trunk of the plantain tree, having no core. This body is like a machine, a nexus of bones and tendons.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: māyopamo 'yaṃ kāyo viparyāsasaṃbhūtaḥ / svapnopamo 'yaṃ kāyo vitathadarśanaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is like a magical illusion, consisting of falsifications. It is like a dream, being an unreal vision.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: pratibhāsopamo 'yaṃ kāyaḥ pūrvakarmapratibhāsatayā saṃdṛśyate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is like a reflection, being the image of former actions.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: pratiśrutkopamo 'yaṃ kāyaḥ pratyayādhīnatvāt /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is like an echo, being dependent on conditioning.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: meghopamo 'yaiḥ kāyaś cittākulavigamalakṣaṇaḥ / vidyutsadṛśo 'yaṃ kāyaḥ kṣaṇabhaṅgayukto 'navasthitaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is like a cloud, being characterized by turbulence and dissolution. It is like a flash of lightning, being unstable, and decaying every moment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: asvāmiko 'yaṃ kāyo nānāpratyayasaṃbhūtaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The body is ownerless, being the product of a variety of conditions.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: anātmo 'yaṃ kāyo 'psadṛśaḥ / nirjīvo 'yaṃ kāyas tejaḥsadṛśaḥ / niṣpudgalo 'yaṃ kāyo vāyusadṛśaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “This body is inert, like the earth selfless, like water lifeless, like fire impersonal, like the wind and nonsubstantial, like space.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: niḥsvabhāvo 'yaṃ kāya ākāśasadṛśaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: This body is unreal, being a collocation of the four main elements.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: śūnyo 'yaṃ kāya ātmātmīyavigataḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is void, not existing as self or as selfpossessed.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: jaḍo 'yaṃ kāyas tṛṇakāṣṭhakuḍyaloṣṭapratibhāsasadṛśaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is inanimate, being like grass, trees, walls, clods of earth, and illusions.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: niśceṣṭo 'yaṃ kāyo vātayantrayukto vartate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is insensate, being driven like a windmill.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: rikto 'yaṃ kāyo 'śucipūtisaṃcayaḥ / tuccho 'yaṃ kāya ucchādanaparimardanavikiraṇavidhvansanadharmā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is filthy, being an agglomeration of pus and excrement. It is false, being fated to be broken and destroyed, in spite of being anointed and massaged.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: upadruto 'yaṃ kāyaś caturuttaraiś caturbhī rogaśataiḥ / jīrṇodapānasadṛśo 'yaṃ kāyaḥ sadā jarābhibhūtaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is afflicted by the four hundred and four diseases. It is like an ancient well, constantly overwhelmed by old age.
