Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tatra yuṣmābhir evaṃrūpe kāye nirvidvirāga utpādayitavyas tathāgatakāye ca spṛhotpādayitavyā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: You should despair of it and should arouse your admiration for the body of the Tathāgata.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  dharmakāyo hi mārṣāḥ tathāgatakāyo dānanirjātaḥ śīlanirjātaḥ samādhinirjātaḥ prajñānirjāto vimuktinirjāto vimuktijñānadarśananirjātaḥ
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The body of a tathāgata is born of the stores of merit and wisdom. It is born of morality, of concentration, of wisdom, of the liberations, and of the knowledge and vision of liberation. It is born of love, compassion, joy, and impartiality.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: maitrīkaruṇāmuditopekṣānirjātaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is born of charity, discipline, and selfcontrol.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: dānadamasaṃyamanirjātaḥ kṣāntisauratyanirjāto dṛḍhavīryakuśalamūlanirjāto dhyānavimokṣasamādhisamāpattinirjātaḥ śrutaprajñopāyanirjātaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is born of patience and gentleness. It is born of the roots of virtue planted by solid efforts. It is born of the concentrations, the liberations, the meditations, and the absorptions. It is born of learning, wisdom, and liberative art.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyanirjātaḥ śamathavidarśanānirjāto daśabalanirjātaś caturvaiśāradyanirjātaḥ / aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmanirjātaḥ sarvapāramitānirjātaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is born of the thirtyseven aids to enlightenment. It is born of mental quiescence and transcendental analysis. It is born of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen special qualities. It is born of all the transcendences.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: abhijñāvidyānirjātaḥ sarvākuśaladharmaprahāṇāya nirjātaḥ sarvakuśaladharmaparigrahanirjātaḥ satyanirjāto bhūtanirjāto 'pramādanirjātaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is born from sciences and superknowledges. It is born of the abandonment of all evil qualities, and of the gathering of all good qualities. It is born of truth. It is born of reality. It is born of conscious awareness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: apramāṇaśubhakarmanirjāto mārṣās tathāgatakāyas tatra yuṣmābhiḥ spṛhā kartavyā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Friends, the body of a tathāgata is born of innumerable good works.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sarvasatvānāṃ ca sarvakleśavyādhiprahāṇāyānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpādayitavyāni /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Toward such a body you should turn your aspirations, and, in order to eliminate the sicknesses of the passions of all living beings, you should conceive the spirit of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  evaṃ vimalakīrtir licchavis tathā saṃnipatitānāṃ teṣāṃ glānaparipṛcchakānāṃ tathā tathā dharmaṃ deśayati yad bahūni satvaśatasahasrāṇy anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: While the Licchavi Vimalakīrti thus taught the Dharma to those who had come to inquire about his sickness, many hundreds of thousands of living beings conceived the spirit of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: acintyopāyakauśalyaparivarto nāma dvitīyaḥ //
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Disciples’ and the Bodhisattvas’ Reluctance to Visit Vimalakīrti

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  atha vimalakīrter licchaver etad abhavat ahaṃ ca glāna ābādhiko mañcasamārūḍhaḥ, na ca māṃ tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ samanvāharati, na ca me glānaparipṛcchakaṃ kaṃcit preṣayaty anukaṃpām upādāya /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Then, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti thought to himself, “I am sick, lying on my bed in pain, yet the Tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly accomplished Buddha, does not consider me or take pity upon me, and sends no one to inquire after my illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  samanvāhṛtaś ca bhagavatā vimalakīrtir licchaviḥ / atha bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram āmantrayate sma gaccha tvaṃ śāriputra vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Lord knew this thought in the mind of Vimalakīrti and said to the venerable Śāriputra, “Śāriputra, go to inquire after the illness of the Licchavi Vimalakīrti.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: evam ukta āyuṣmāñ śāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Thus addressed, the venerable Śāriputra answered the Buddha, “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to ask the Licchavi Vimalakīrti about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ekasmin samaye 'nyatamasmin vṛkṣamūle pratisaṃlīno 'bhūvam / vimalakīrtiś ca licchavir yena tad vṛkṣamūlaṃ tenopasaṃkramya mām etad avocat Vkn  na bhadantaśāriputra evaṃ pratisaṃlayanaṃ saṃlātavyaṃ yathā tvaṃ pratisaṃlīnaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: I remember one day, when I was sitting at the foot of a tree in the forest, absorbed in contemplation, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came to the foot of that tree and said to me, ‘Reverend Śāriputra, this is not the way to absorb yourself in contemplation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: api tu tathā pratisaṃlīyaś ca yathā traidhātuke na kāyaś cittaṃ vā saṃdṛśyate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: You should absorb yourself in contemplation so that neither body nor mind appear anywhere in the three realms.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tathā pratisaṃlīyaś ca yathā nirodhāc ca na vyuttiṣṭhasi sarveryāpatheṣu ca saṃdṛśyase /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: You should absorb yourself in contemplation in such a way that you can manifest all ordinary behavior without forsaking cessation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tathā pratisaṃlīyaś ca yathā te na cādhyātmaṃ cittam avasthitaṃ bhaven na bahirdhopavicaret /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: You should absorb yourself in contemplation so that the mind neither settles within nor moves without toward external forms.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tathā pratisaṃlīyaś ca yathā sarvadṛṣṭigatebhyaś ca na calasi saptatriṃśatsu ca bodhipakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu saṃdṛśyase /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: You should absorb yourself in contemplation in such a way that the thirtyseven aids to enlightenment are manifest without deviation toward any convictions.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tathā pratisaṃlīyaś ca yathā saṃsārāvacarāṃś ca kleśān na prajahāsi nirvāṇasamavasaraṇaś ca bhavasi /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: You should absorb yourself in contemplation in such a way that you are released in liberation without abandoning the passions that are the province of the world.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ye bhadantaśāriputra evaṃ pratisaṃlayanaṃ pratisaṃlīyante teṣāṃ bhagavān pratisaṃlayanam anujānāti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Reverend Śāriputra, those who absorb themselves in contemplation in such a way are declared by the Lord to be truly absorbed in contemplation.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  so 'haṃ bhagavan etāṃ śrutvā tūṣṇīm evābhūvam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Lord, when I heard this teaching, I was unable to reply and remained silent.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tan nāham utsahe tasya kulaputrasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Therefore, I am reluctant to go to ask that good man about his sickness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ mahāmaudgalyāyanam āmantrayate sma gaccha tvaṃ maudgalyāyana vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha then said to the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, “Maudgalyāyana, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: maudgalyāyano 'py āha nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Maudgalyāyana replied, “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: abhijānāmy ahaṃ bhagavan ekasmin samaye vaiśālyāṃ mahānagaryām anyatamasmin vīthīmukhe gṛhapatibhyo dharmaṃ deśayāmi / tatra māṃ vimalakīrtir licchavir upasaṃkrāmyaivam āha
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: I remember one day when I was teaching the Dharma to the householders in a square in the great city of Vaiśālī, and the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came along and said to me, ‘Reverend Maudgalyāyana, that is not the way to teach the Dharma to the householders in their white clothes.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: api tu tathā bhadantamaudgalyāyana dharmo deśayitavyo yathaiva sa dharmaḥ / dharmo hi bhadantamaudgalyāyana asatvaḥ satvarajovigataḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Dharma must be taught according to reality. “ ‘Reverend Maudgalyāyana, the Dharma is without a living being, because it is free of the dust of living beings.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: nairātmyo rāgarajovigataḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is selfless, because it is free of the dust of desire.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: nirjīvo jāticyutivigataḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is lifeless, because it is free of birth and death.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: niṣpudgalaḥ pūrvāntāparāntaparicchinnaḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is without a person, because it dispenses with past origins and future destinies.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: śānta upaśāntalakṣaṇaḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘The Dharma is peace and pacification, because it is free of desire.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: virāgo 'nārambaṇagatikaḥ, anakṣaraḥ sarvavākyacchedaḥ, anudāhāraḥ sarvormivigataḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It does not become an object, because it is free of words and letters it is inexpressible, and it transcends all movement of mind.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sarvatrānugata ākāśasamasadṛśaḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘The Dharma is omnipresent, because it is like infinite space.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: avarṇaliṅgasaṃsthānaḥ sarvapracāravigataḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is without color, mark, or shape, because it is free of all process.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: amamo mamakāravigataḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is without the concept of “mine,” because it is free of the habitual notion of possession.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: avijñaptiś cittamanovijñānavigataḥ, asadṛśo niṣpratipakṣatvāt,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is without ideation, because it is free of mind, thought, or consciousness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: hetuvilakṣaṇaḥ pratyayāsamāropaḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is without presumption of conditionality, because it does not conform to causes.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: dharmadhātusamavasaraṇaḥ sarvadharmasamāhitaḥ, tathatānugato 'nanugamanayogena, bhūtakoṭipratiṣṭhito 'tyantācalitatvāt,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘It permeates evenly all things, because all are included in the ultimate realm. It conforms to reality by means of the process of nonconformity. It abides at the realitylimit, for it is utterly without fluctuation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: acalitaḥ ṣaḍviṣayāniśritatvāt,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is immovable, because it is independent of the six objects of sense.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: na kvacid gamanāgamano 'navasthitatvāt,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is without coming and going, for it never stands still.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: śūnyatāsamāhita ānimittaprabhāvito 'praṇihitalakṣaṇaḥ, ūhāpohavigataḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is comprised by voidness, it is remarkable through signlessness, and because of wishlessness it is free of presumption and repudiation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: anutkṣepo 'prakṣepaḥ, utpādabhaṅgavigataḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is without establishment and rejection, without birth or destruction.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: anālayaś cakṣuḥśrotraghrāṇajihvākāyamanaḥpathasamatikrāntaḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is without any fundamental consciousness, transcending the range of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and thought.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: anunnato 'navanataḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is without highness and lowness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sthito 'neñjyaṃ prāptaḥ, sarvapracāravigataḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It abides without movement or activity.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  īdṛśasya bhadantamahāmaudgalyāyana dharmasya kīdṛśī deśanā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Reverend Mahā­maudgalyāyana, how could there be a teaching in regard to such a Dharma?

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: dharmadeśaneti bhadantamahāmaudgalyāyana samāropapadam etat / ye 'pi śṛṇvanti te 'pi samāropenaiva śṛṇvanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Reverend Mahā­maudgalyāyana, even the expression “to teach the Dharma” is presumptuous, and those who listen to it listen to presumption.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yatra bhadantamaudgalyāyana asamāropapadaṃ na tatra deśyate na śrūyate na vijñāyate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Reverend Maudgalyāyana, where there are no presumptuous words, there is no teacher of the Dharma, no one to listen, and no one to understand.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tadyathā māyāpuruṣo māyāpuruṣebhyo dharmaṃ deśayati /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is as if an illusory person were to teach the Dharma to illusory people.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  evaṃ hi cittāvasthānena dharmo deśayitavyaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Therefore, you should teach the Dharma by keeping your mind on this.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: satvendriyakuśalena ca te bhavitavyam,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: You should be adept in regard to the spiritual faculties of living beings.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sudṛṣṭaprajñādarśanena mahākaruṇāmukhībhūtena mahāyānasaṃvarṇakena buddhekṛtajñena śuddhāśayena dharmaniruktividhijñena, triratnavaṃśānupacchedāya ca te dharmo deśayitavyaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: By means of the correct vision of the wisdomeye, manifesting the great compassion, acknowledging the benevolent activity of the Buddha, purifying your intentions, and understanding the definitive expressions of the Dharma, you should teach the Dharma in order that the continuity of the Three Jewels may never be interrupted.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tena bhagavan tathā tathā dharmo deśito yathā tato gṛhapatiparsado 'ṣṭānāṃ gṛhapatiśatānām anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpannāni ahaṃ ca niṣpratibhāno 'bhūvam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Lord, when Vimalakīrti had discoursed thus, eight hundred householders in the crowd conceived the spirit of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment, and I myself was speechless.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Therefore, Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to this good man to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ mahākāśyapam āmantrayate sma gaccha tvaṃ mahākāśyapa vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ / mahākāśyapo 'py āha
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha then said to the venerable Mahākāśyapa, “Mahākāśyapa, you go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tatra māṃ vimalakirtir licchavir upasaṃkramyaivam āha Vkn  prādeśikī bhadantamahākāśyapasya karuṇāmaitrī, yan mahākulāny utsṛjya daridrakulāny upasaṃkrāmasi / api tu bhadantamahākāśyapa dharmasamatāpratiṣṭhitena te bhavitavyam / sarvadā sarvasatvasamanvāhāreṇa piṇḍapātaḥ paryeṣṭavyaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: I remember one day, when I was in the street of the poor begging for my food, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came along and said to me, ‘Reverend Mahākāśyapa, to avoid the houses of the wealthy, and to favor the houses of the poorthis is partiality in benevolence. Reverend Mahākāśyapa, you should dwell on the fact of the equality of things, and you should seek alms with consideration for all living beings at all times.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: anāhāreṇa cāhāraḥ paryeṣṭavyaḥ / parapiṇḍagrāhāpanayāya ca te piṇḍāya caritavyam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: You should beg your food in awareness of the ultimate nonexistence of food. You should seek alms for the sake of eliminating the materialism of others.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: śūnyagrāmādhiṣṭhitena ca grāmaḥ praveṣṭavyaḥ / naranārīparipākāya ca te nagaraṃ praveṣṭavyam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: When you enter a town, you should keep in mind its actual voidness, yet you should proceed through it in order to develop men and women.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: buddhakulakulīnena ca te kulāny upasaṃkramitavyāni /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: You should enter homes as if entering the family of the Buddha.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  apratigrahaṇatayā ca piṇḍapātaḥ pratigrāhyaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: You should accept alms by not taking anything.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: jātyandhasamatayā ca rūpāṇi draṣṭavyāni / pratiśrutakopamatayā ca śabdāḥ śrotavyāḥ / vātasamatayā ca gandhā ghrātavyāḥ / avijñaptito rasā āsvādayitavyāḥ / jñānāsparśanatayā ca sparśāḥ spraṣṭavyāḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: You should see form like a man blind from birth, hear sounds as if they were echoes, smell scents as if they were like wind, experience tastes without any discrimination, touch tangible objects without there being in gnosis any contact, and know things with the consciousness of an illusory creature.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yo 'svabhāvo 'parabhāvaś ca tad anujjvalitam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: That which is without a state of being self and a state of being other does not burn.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yad anujjvalitaṃ tan na śāmyati /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: And what does not burn will not be extinguished.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  yadi sthaviro mahākāśyapo 'ṣṭau ca mithyātvāni samatikrāmet, aṣṭau ca vimokṣān samāpadyeta, mithyāsamatayā ca samyaktvasamatām avataret, ekena ca piṇḍapātena sarvasatvān pratipādayet, sarvabuddhān sarvāryāṃś ca pratipādya paścād ātmanā paribhuñjīta,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Elder Mahākāśyapa, if, equipoised in the eight liberations without transcending the eight perverse paths, you can enter the sameness of reality by means of the sameness of perversity, and if you can make a gift to all living beings and an offering to all the noble ones and buddhas out of even a single measure of alms, then you yourself may eat.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tathā ca paribhuñjīta yathā na saṃkleśo na vigatakleśaḥ, paribhuñjīta na samāhito na vyutthitaḥ, na saṃsārasthito na nirvāṇasthitaḥ paribhuñjīta /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Thus, when you eat, after offering, you should be neither affected by afflictions nor free of afflictions, neither involved in concentration nor free of concentration, neither living in the world nor abiding in liberation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ye ca bhadantāya piṇḍapātaṃ dadati te teṣāṃ nālpaphalaṃ na mahāphalaiḥ bhavet /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Furthermore, those who give such alms, reverend, have neither great merit nor small merit, neither gain nor loss.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: buddhagatisamavasaraṇāya ca bhaveta na śrāvakagatisamavasaraṇāya /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: They should follow the way of the buddhas, not the way of the disciples.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: evaṃ sthaviro mahākāśyapo 'moghaṃ rāṣṭrapiṇḍaṃ paribhuñjīta /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Only in this way, Elder Mahākāśyapa, is the practice of eating by alms meaningful.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  so 'haṃ bhagavan imaṃ dharmanirdeśaṃ śrutvāścaryaprāptaḥ sarvabodhisatvān namasyāmi /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Lord, when I heard this teaching, I was astonished and thought, ‘Reverence to all bodhisattvas!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ko 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ notpādayet / tataḥ prabhṛti me na kaścit satvaḥ śrāvakayāne pratyekabuddhayāne vā samādāpitapūrvo 'nyatra mahāyānāt /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: If a lay bodhisattva may be endowed with such eloquence, who is there who would not conceive the spirit of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment?’ From that time forth, I no longer recommend the vehicles of the disciples and of the solitary sages but recommend the Mahāyāna.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya kulaputrasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: And thus, Lord, I am reluctant to go to this good man to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim āmantrayate sma gaccha tvaṃ subhūte vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha then said to the venerable Subhūti, “Subhūti, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: subhūtir apy āha nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Subhūti replied, “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to this good man to inquire about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: abhijānāmy ahaṃ bhagavan ekasmin samaye vaiśālyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ piṇḍāya carāmi / vimalakīrter licchaver niveśanaṃ piṇḍāya praviṣṭaḥ / tasya me vimalakīrtir licchaviḥ pātraṃ gṛhītvā praṇītena bhojanena pratipūryaivam āha Vkn  sacet tvaṃ bhadantasubhūte āmiṣasamatayā sarvadharmasamatām anugataḥ sarvadharmasamatayā ca buddhadharmasamatām anugata eva,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: My Lord, I remember one day, when I went to beg my food at the house of the Licchavi Vimalakīrti in the great city of Vaiśālī, he took my bowl and filled it with some excellent food and said to me, ‘Reverend Subhūti, take this food if you understand the sameness of all things through the sameness of material objects, and if you understand the sameness of the qualities of the Buddha through the sameness of all things.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: na ca te 'vidyā bhavatṛṣṇā ca samudghātitā na ca vidyāvimuktī utpādite / ānantaryasamatayā ca te samādhivimuktiḥ / na cāsi mukto na baddhaḥ / na ca te catvāry āryasatyāni dṛṣṭāni na ca na dṛṣṭasatyaḥ / na prāptaphalo na pṛthagjanasamavasaraṇaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Take this food if, without abandoning desire, hatred, and folly, you can avoid association with them if you can follow the path of the single way without ever disturbing the egoistic views if, neither conquering ignorance and the craving for existence, nor producing knowledge and liberation, your liberation being the same as the equality of the uninterruptible sins, you are neither liberated nor bound if you do not see the four noble truths, yet are not one who “has not seen the truth” if you are also neither “one who has attained fruition,” nor “an ordinary person,” while not having eliminated the qualities of “an ordinary person” if you are not a noble one, and not a nonnoble one and if, though you are in the presence of all things, you are free of any notion of “all things.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  na ca te śāstā dṛṣṭo na dharmaḥ śruto na saṃghaḥ paryupāsitaḥ / ye ca te ṣaṭ śāstāras tadyathā pūraṇaḥ kāśyapaḥ, maskarī gośālīputraḥ, saṃjayo vairāṣṭrikaputraḥ, kakudaḥ kātyāyanaḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Take this food, reverend Subhūti, if, without seeing the Buddha, hearing the Dharma, or serving the Saṅgha, you undertake the religious life under the six outsider mastersnamely, Purāṇa Kāśyapa, Māskārin Gośāli­putra, Saṃjāyin Vairaṭi­putra, Kakuda Kātyāyana, Ajita Keśakambala, and Nirgrantha Jñāti­putra, and follow the ways they prescribe.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: te ca bhadantasya śāstāras tāṃś ca niśritya pravrajito yadgāminas te ṣaṭ śāstāras tadgāmy evāryasubhūtiḥ, Vkn  sarvadṛṣṭigateṣu cāryaman antargato na cāntamadhyaprāptaḥ, aṣṭākṣaṇasamavasaraṇaś cāsi na cāsi lakṣaṇam anuprāptaḥ, saṃkleśena cāsi samo 'vyavadānam adhigataḥ, yā ca sarvasatvānām araṇā sā bhadantasyāpy araṇā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Take this food, reverend Subhūti, if, entertaining all false views, you find neither extremes nor middle if, bound up in the eight adversities, you do not obtain favorable conditions if, assimilating the passions, you do not attain purification if the dispassion of all living beings is your dispassion, reverend if those who make offerings to you are not thereby purified if those who offer you food, reverend, still fall into the three bad migrations if you associate with all māras if you entertain all passions if the nature of passions is the nature of a reverend if you have hostile feelings toward all living beings if you despise all the buddhas if you criticize all the teachings of the Buddha if you do not rely on the saṅgha and finally, if you never enter ultimate liberation.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tasya me bhagavan imaṃ dharmanirdeśaṃ śrutvāndhakāraprāptā diśo 'bhūvan ḥ tat kim asmai nirdiśāmi, katham vā pratipadya iti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Lord, when I heard these words of the Licchavi Vimalakīrti, I wondered what I should say and what I should do, but I was totally in the dark.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: so 'haṃ tat pātram utsṛjya tato gṛhān niṣkramiṣyāmīti / vimalakīrtir Iicchavir mām evam āha mā bhadantasubhūte akṣarebhya uttrasīḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Leaving the bowl, I was about to leave the house when the Licchavi Vimalakīrti said to me, ‘Reverend Subhūti, do not fear these words, and pick up your bowl.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tat kiṃ manyase bhadantasubhūte,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: What do you think, reverend Subhūti?

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yadi tathāgatanirmita evam ucyeta kaccit sa uttraset / so 'ham avocam
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: If it were an incarnation created by the Tathāgata who spoke thus to you, would you be afraid?’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: no hīdaṃ kulaputra / sa mām evam āha nirmitamāyāsvabhāvebhyo bhadantasubhūte sarvadharmebhyo nottrasitavyam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “I answered, ‘No indeed, noble sir!’ He then said, ‘Reverend Subhūti, the nature of all things is like illusion, like a magical incarnation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tat kasmād dhetoḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: So you should not fear them.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sarvāṇi hi tāni vacanāni tatsvabhāvāni, evaṃ paṇḍitā akṣareṣu na sajjanti na tebhya uttrasyanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: All words also have that nature, and thus the wise are not attached to words, nor do they fear them.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sarvāṇi tāny akṣarāṇy anakṣarāṇi sthāpayitvā vimuktiṃ vimuktilakṣaṇāṃś ca sarvadharmān /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: All language does not ultimately exist, except as liberation. The nature of all things is liberation.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  iha nirdeśe nirdiśyamāne dvayor devaputraśatayor virajo vigatamalaṃ dharmeṣu dharmacakṣur viśuddham, pañcānāṃ ca devaputraśatānām ānulomikyāḥ kṣānteḥ pratilambho 'bhūt /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “When Vimalakīrti had discoursed in this way, two hundred gods obtained the pure doctrinal vision in regard to all things, without obscurity or defilement, and five hundred gods obtained the conformative tolerance.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ahaṃ ca niṣpratibhāno 'bhūvam,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: As for me, I was speechless and unable to respond to him.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tan nāham utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Therefore, Lord, I am reluctant to go to this good man to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ pūrṇaṃ maitrāyaṇīputram āmantrayate sma gaccha tvaṃ pūrṇa vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha then said to the venerable Pūrṇa­maitrāyaṇī­putra, “Pūrṇa, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: pūrṇo 'py āha nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Pūrṇa replied, “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to this good man to inquire about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: abhijānāmy ahaṃ bhagavan ekasmin samaye vanasyānyatamasmin pṛthivīpradeśa ādikarmikāṇāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ dharmaṃ deśayāmi / tatra vimalakīrtir licchavir upasaṃkramya mām evam āha Vkn  samāpadya bhadantapūrṇa eteṣāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ cittaṃ vyavalokya dharmaṃ deśaya /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Lord, I remember one day, when I was teaching the Dharma to some young monks in the great forest, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and said to me, ‘Reverend Pūrṇa, first concentrate yourself, regard the minds of these young bhikṣus, and then teach them the Dharma!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: mā mahāratnabhājaneṣu prati kulmāṣān prākṣaipsīḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Do not put rotten food into a jeweled bowl!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: jāniṣva tāvat kimāśayā ete bhikṣava iti / mā vaiḍūryaratnaṃ kācamaṇikaiḥ samānīkārṣīḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: First understand the inclinations of these monks, and do not confuse priceless sapphires with glass beads!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: mā bhadantapūrṇa apratyavekṣyā satvendriyeṣu prādeśikendriyatvam upasaṃhārṣīḥ / mā akṣatāṃ kṣiṇuṣva / mā mahāmārgam avatartukāmān bhandarathyāṃ praveśaya / mā mahāsāgaraṃ goṣpade praveśaya / mā sūryaprabhāṃ khadyotakair nirvartaya /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Reverend Pūrṇa, without examining the spiritual faculties of living beings, do not presume upon the onesidedness of their faculties do not wound those who are without wounds do not impose a narrow path upon those who aspire to a great path do not try to pour the great ocean into the hoofprint of an ox do not try to put Mount Sumeru into a grain of mustard do not confuse the brilliance of the sun with the light of a glowworm and do not expose those who admire the roar of a lion to the howl of a jackal!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: api bhadantapūrṇa sarve hy ete bhikṣavo mahāyānasaṃprasthitā amuṣitabodhicittāḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Reverend Pūrṇa, all these monks were formerly engaged in the Mahāyāna but have forgotten the spirit of enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: teṣāṃ bhadantapūrṇa mā śrāvakayānam upadarśaya /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: So do not instruct them in the Disciple Vehicle.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: kaṣṭaṃ hi śrāvakayānam / jātyandhā iva me śrāvakāḥ pratibhānti satvendriyavimātratājñāne /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Disciple Vehicle is not ultimately valid, and you disciples are like men blind from birth, in regard to recognition of the degrees of the spiritual faculties of living beings.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  atha vimalakīrtir licchavis tasyāṃ velāyāṃ tathārūpaṃ samādhiṃ samāpadyate sma / yathā te bhikṣavo 'nekavidhaṃ pūrvenivāsam anusmaraṇti sma / te pañcabuddhaśataparyupāsitakuśalamūlāḥ samyaksaṃbodhaye,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “At that moment, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti entered into such a concentration that those monks were caused to remember their various former lives, in which they had produced the roots of virtue by serving five hundred buddhas for the sake of perfect enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: teṣāṃ tad bodhicittam āmukhībhūtam / te tasya satpuruṣasya pādau śirobhiḥ praṇamya tatraiva niṣaṇṇāḥ prāñjalayo bhūtvā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: As soon as their own spirits of enlightenment had become clear to them, they bowed at the feet of that good man and pressed their palms together in reverence.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: teṣāṃ tādṛśī dharmadeśanā kṛtā yathāvaivartikāḥ saṃvṛttā anuttarasyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He taught them the Dharma, and they all attained the stage of irreversibility from unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: These disciples are not expert in discerning the superiority and inferiority of the spiritual faculties of living beings, and they are not always in a state of concentration like the Tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly accomplished Buddha.’ Therefore, Lord, I am reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his health.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ kātyāyanam āmantrayate sma gaccha tvaṃ kātyāyana vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha then said to the venerable Mahākātyāyana, “Kātyāyana, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: kātyāyano 'py āha nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Kātyāyana replied, “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: abhijānāmy ahaṃ bhagavan bhagavatā saṃkṣiptena bhikṣūṇām avavādo dattaḥ / teṣāṃ sūtrapadaviniścayāya dharmaṃ deśayāmi, yad idam anityārthaṃ duḥkhārtham anātmārthaṃ śāntārtham / tatra vimalakīrtir licchavir upasaṃkramya mām evam āha
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Lord, I remember one day when, after the Lord had given some brief instruction to the monks, I was defining the expressions of that discourse by teaching the meaning of impermanence, suffering, selflessness, and peace, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and said to me, ‘Reverend Mahākātyāyana, do not teach an ultimate reality endowed with activity, production, and destruction!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yo bhadantamahākātyāyana atyantatayā na jāto na janiṣyati notpanno na niruddho na nirotsyate 'yam anityārthaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Reverend Mahākātyāyana, nothing was ever destroyed, is destroyed, or will ever be destroyed.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yaḥ pañcānāṃ skandhānāṃ śūnyatānugamānutpādānirodhārtho 'yaṃ duḥkhārthaḥ / yad ātmānātmayor advayatvam ayam anātmārthaḥ / yo 'svabhāvo 'parabhāvas tad anujjvalitam, yad anujvalitaṃ na tac chāmyati, yo 'tyantopaśamo 'yaṃ śāntārthaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Such is the meaning of “impermanence.” The meaning of the realization of birthlessness, through the realization of the voidness of the five aggregates, is the meaning of “suffering.” The fact of the nonduality of self and selflessness is the meaning of “selflessness.” That which has no intrinsic substance and no other sort of substance does not burn, and what does not burn is not extinguished such lack of extinction is the meaning of “peace.” ’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  asmin khalu punar nirdeśe nirdiśyamāne teṣāṃ bhikṣūṇām anupādāyāsravebhyaś cittāni vimuktāni /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “When he had discoursed thus, the minds of the monks were liberated from their defilements and entered a state of nongrasping.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Therefore, Lord, I am reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam aniruddham āmantrayate sma gaccha tvam aniruddha vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ / aniruddho 'py āha
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha then said to the venerable Aniruddha, “Aniruddha, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “My Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  abhijānāmy ahaṃ bhagavan anyatamasmiṃś caṅkrame caṅkramāmi / tatra śubhavyūho nāma brahmā daśabhir brahmasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ taṃ pradeśam avabhāsya yenāhaṃ tenopasaṃkramya mama pādau śirasābhivandyaikānte sthitvā mām etad avocat kiyad āyuṣmān aniruddho divyena cakṣuṣā paśyati /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: I remember, Lord, one day when I was taking a walk, the great Brahmā named Śubhavyūha and the ten thousand other Brahmās who accompanied him illuminated the place with their radiance and, having bowed their heads at my feet, withdrew to one side and asked me, ‘Reverend Aniruddha, you have been proclaimed by the Buddha to be the foremost among those who possess the divine eye.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ahaṃ mārṣa imaṃ triṃ sāhasramahāsāhasraṃ lokadhātuṃ bhagavataḥ śākyamuner buddhakṣetraṃ tad yathāpi nāma karatale nyastam āmalakaphalam evaṃ paśyāmi / Vkn  iyaṃ ca kathā pravṛttā vimalakīrtiś ca licchavis taṃ pradeśam upasaṃkrāmat / upasaṃkramya mama pādau śirasā vanditvaivam āha kiṃ bhadantāniruddha divyaṃ cakṣur abhisaṃskāralakṣaṇam utānabhisaṃskāralakṣaṇam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: To what distance does the divine vision of the venerable Aniruddha extend?’ I answered, ‘Friends, I see the entire billionworld galactic universe of the Lord Śākyamuni just as plainly as a man of ordinary vision sees a myrobalan nut on the palm of his hand.’ When I had said these words, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and, having bowed his head at my feet, said to me, ‘Reverend Aniruddha, is your divine eye compounded in nature? Or is it uncompounded in nature?

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yady abhisaṃskāralakṣaṇaṃ tad bāhyaiḥ pañcābhijñaiḥ samam,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: If it is compounded in nature, it is the same as the superknowledges of the outsiders.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: athānabhisaṃskāralakṣaṇaṃ anabhisaṃskāro 'saṃskṛtas tena na śakyaṃ draṣṭum / tat kathaṃ sthaviraḥ paśyati /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: If it is uncompounded in nature, then it is not constructed and, as such, is incapable of seeing. Then, how do you see, O elder?’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: so 'haṃ tūṣṇīm abhūvam / Vkn  sa ca brahmā tasya satpuruṣasyemaṃ nirdeśaṃ śrutvāścaryaprāptas taṃ namaskṛtyaitad avocat
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “At these words, I became speechless, and Brahmā also was amazed to hear this teaching from that good man.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ke loke divyacakṣuṣaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Having bowed to him, he said, ‘Who then, in the world, possesses the divine eye?’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: āha buddhā bhagavanto loke divyacakṣuṣo ye samāhitāvasthāṃ ca na vijahati sarvabuddhakṣetrāṇi ca paśyanti / na ca dvayaprabhāvitāḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Vimalakīrti answered, ‘In the world, it is the buddhas who have the divine eye. They see all the buddhafields without even leaving their state of concentration and without being affected by duality.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  atha sa brahmemaṃ nirdeśaṃ śrutvā daśasahasraparivāro 'dhyāśayenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayati sma /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Having heard these words, the ten thousand Brahmās were inspired with high resolve and conceived the spirit of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sa māṃ vanditvā taṃ ca satpuruṣam abhivādya tatraivāntarhitaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Having paid homage and respect both to me and to that good man, they disappeared.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ahaṃ ca niṣpratibhāno 'bhūvam / tan nāham utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: As for me, I remained speechless, and therefore I am reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam upālim āmantrayate sma gaccha tvam upāle vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha then said to the venerable Upāli, “Upāli, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: upālir apy āha nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Upāli replied, “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: abhijānāmy ahaṃ bhagavan anyatamau dvau bhikṣū āpattim āpannau, tau bhagavataḥ paryapatrapamāṇau bhagavantaṃ nopasaṃkrāmataḥ / tau yenāhaṃ tenopasaṃkrāntāv upasaṃkrāmya mām etad avocatām /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Lord, I remember that one day there were two monks who had committed some infraction and were too ashamed to appear before the Lord, so they came to me and said, ‘Reverend Upāli, we have both committed an infraction but are too ashamed to appear before the Buddha.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tāv āvāṃ paryapatrapamāṇau bhagavantam upasaṃkramituṃ notsahāvahe /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Venerable Upāli, kindly remove our anxieties by absolving us of these infractions.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  so 'haṃ bhagavaṃs tau bhikṣū dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayāmi / vimalakīrtiś ca licchavis taṃ pradeśam anuprāptaḥ sa mām etad avocat mā bhadantopāle etau bhikṣū āgāḍhīkārṣīḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Lord, while I was giving those two monks some religious discourse, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and said to me, ‘Reverend Upāli, do not aggravate further the sins of these two monks.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: vinodayānayor āpattim, mā āvilīkārṣīḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Without perplexing them, relieve their remorse.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: na hi bhadantopāle āpattir adhyātmapratiṣṭhitā na bahirdhāsaṃkrānto nobhayam antareṇopalabhyate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Reverend Upāli, sin is not to be apprehended within, or without, or between the two.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: uktaṃ hi bhagavatā cittasaṃkleśāt satvāḥ saṃkliśyante cittavyavadānād viśudhyante /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha has said, “Living beings are afflicted by the passions of thought, and they are purified by the purification of thought.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: cittaṃ ca bhadantopāle nādhyātmapratiṣṭhitaṃ na bahirdhā nobhayam antareṇopalabhyate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Reverend Upāli, the mind is neither within nor without, nor is it to be apprehended between the two.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yathā cittaṃ tathāpattiḥ, yathāpattis tathā sarvadharmāḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Sin is just the same as the mind, and all things are just the same as sin.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tathatāṃ na vyativartante /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: They do not escape this same reality.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yā bhadantopāle cittasya prakṛtir yayā cittaprakṛtyā bhadantasya cittaṃ vimuktam, kiṃ jātu sā cittaprakṛtiḥ saṃkliṣṭā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Reverend Upāli, this nature of the mind, by virtue of which your mind, reverend, is liberateddoes it ever become afflicted?’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: āha no hidam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Never,’ I replied.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: āha tatprakṛtikāni bhadantopāle sarvasatvānāṃ cittāni /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Reverend Upāli, the minds of all living beings have that very nature.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  saṃkalpo bhadantopāle kleśaḥ / akalpāvikalpā ca prakṛtiḥ / viparyāsaḥ saṃkleśaḥ, aviparyastā ca prakṛtiḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Reverend Upāli, conceptualization is total affliction, and not conceptualizing and not discriminating is their true nature. Misapprehension is total affliction, and nonmisapprehension is their true nature.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ātmasamāropaḥ saṃkleśaḥ, nairātmyā ca prakṛtiḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The presumption of self is total affliction, and selflessness is their true nature.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: utpannabhagnānavasthitā bhadantopāle sarvadharmā māyāmeghavidyutsadṛśāḥ / nirapekṣāḥ sarvadharmāḥ kṣaṇam api nāvatiṣṭhante / svapnamarīcisadṛśāḥ sarvadharmā vitathadarśanāḥ / dakacandrapratibimbasadṛśāḥ sarvadharmāś cittaparikalpenotpadyante /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Reverend Upāli, all things are without production, destruction, and duration, like magical illusions, clouds, and lightning all things are evanescent, not remaining even for an instant all things are like dreams, hallucinations, and unreal visions all things are like the reflection of the moon in water and like a mirrorimage they are born of mental construction.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ye tv evaṃ jānanti te vinayadharā ity ucyante / ya evaṃ vinītās te suvinītāḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Those who know this are called the true upholders of the discipline, and those disciplined in that way are indeed well disciplined.’ ”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  atha tau bhikṣu etad avocatām prajñādharo vinayadharo 'yam upāsakaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Then the two monks said, ‘This householder is extremely well endowed with wisdom.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: na tv ayaṃ bhadantopālir yo bhagavatā vinayadharāṇām agro nirdiṣṭaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The reverend Upāli, who was proclaimed by the Lord as the foremost of the upholders of the discipline, is not his equal.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tāv aham evaṃ vadāmi mā bhikṣū atra gṛhapatisaṃjñām utpādayatām /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “I then said to the two monks, ‘Do not entertain the notion that he is a mere householder!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tathāgataṃ sthāpayitvā nāsti kaścic chrāvako vā bodhisatvo vā, ya etasya pratibhānam ācchindyāt / tādṛśa etasya prajñālokaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: With the exception of the Tathāgata himself, there is no disciple or bodhisattva capable of competing with his eloquence or rivaling the brilliance of his wisdom.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  atha tau bhikṣū vinītakaukṛtyāv adhyāśayena tatraivānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditavantau,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Thereupon, the two monks, delivered from their anxieties and inspired with a high resolve, conceived the spirit of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: taṃ ca satpuruṣam abhivandyaivam āhatuḥ
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Bowing down to that good man, they made the wish

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sarvasatvā īdṛśasya pratibhānasya lābhino bhavantu / tan nāham utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: ‘May all living beings attain eloquence such as this!’ Therefore, I am reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ rāhulam āmantrayate sma gaccha tvaṃ rāhula vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha then said to the venerable Rāhula, “Rāhula, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: rāhulo 'py āha nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Rāhula replied, “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: abhijānāmy ahaṃ bhagavan ekasmin samaye saṃbahulā licchavikumārakā yenāhaṃ tenopasaṃkramya mām etad avocan tvaṃ rāhula tasya bhagavataḥ putraś cakravartirājyam utsṛjya pravrajitaḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Lord, I remember that one day many young Licchavi gentlemen came to the place where I was and said to me, ‘Reverend Rāhula, you are the son of the Lord, and, having renounced a kingdom of a universal monarch, you have left the world.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tatra ke te pravrajyāyā guṇānuśaṃsāḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: What are the virtues and benefits you saw in leaving the world?’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: teṣām ahaṃ yathārūpaṃ pravrajyāyā guṇānuśaṃsā nirdiśāmi, vimalakīrtir licchavir yenāhaṃ tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ / sa mām abhivandyaitad avocat Vkn  na bhadantarāhula evaṃ pravrajyāyā guṇānuśaṃsā nirdeṣṭavyā yathā tvaṃ nirdiśasi /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “As I was teaching them properly the benefits and virtues of renouncing the world, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and, having greeted me, said, ‘Reverend Rāhula, you should not teach the benefits and virtues of renunciation in the way that you do.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: nirguṇā niranuśaṃsā hi pravrajyā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Renunciation is itself the very absence of virtues and benefits.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yatra bhadantarāhula saṃskṛtapravṛttis tatra guṇānuśaṃsā / pravrajyā cāsaṃskṛtā, asaṃskṛte ca na guṇā nānuśāṃsā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Reverend Rāhula, one may speak of benefits and virtues in regard to compounded things, but renunciation is uncompounded, and there can be no question of benefits and virtues in regard to the uncompounded.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: pravrajyā bhadantarāhula arūpiṇi rūpavigatā, panthā nirvāṇasya,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is free of the extreme views of beginning and end. It is the path of liberation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: praśaṃsitā paṇḍitaiḥ, parigṛhītāryaiḥ, parājayaḥ sarvamārāṇām,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is praised by the wise, embraced by the noble ones, and causes the defeat of all māras.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: pañcagatyuttāraṇī, pañcacakṣuviśodhanī, pañcabalapratilambhā, pañcendriyapratiṣṭhā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It liberates from the five states of existence, purifies the five eyes, cultivates the five powers, and supports the five spiritual faculties.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: pareṣām anupaghātaḥ, pāpadharmāsaṃsṛṣṭā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Renunciation is totally harmless to others and is not adulterated with evil things.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: paratīrthyapramardanī, prajñaptisamatikrāntā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It disciplines the outsiders, transcending all denominations.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: paṅke saṃkramaḥ, amamā mamakāravigatā, aparigrahā, anupādānā, anākulā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the bridge over the swamp of desire, without grasping, and free of the habits of “I” and “mine.” It is without attachment and without disturbance, eliminating all commotion.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ākulaprahīṇā, svacittadarśanī paracittasaṃrakṣaṇī, śamathānukūlā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It disciplines one’s own mind and protects the minds of others. It favors mental quiescence and stimulates transcendental analysis.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sarvato 'navadyā / iyam ucyate pravrajyā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is irreproachable in all respects and so is called renunciation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ya evaṃ pravrajitās te supravrajitāḥ / Vkn  pravrajata yūyaṃ kumārakāḥ svākhyāte dharmavinaye /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Those who leave the mundane in this way are called “truly renunciant.” Young men, renounce the world in the light of this clear teaching!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: durlabho hi buddhotpādaḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The appearance of the Buddha is extremely rare.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: durlabhā kṣaṇasaṃpat, durlabho manuṣyapratilambhaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Human life endowed with leisure and opportunity is very hard to obtain. To be a human being is very precious.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: te kumārakā evam āhuḥ śrutam asmābhir gṛhapate, na tathāgato 'navasṛṣṭaṃ mātāpitṛbhyāṃ pravrājayatīti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “The young men complained, ‘But, householder, we have heard the Tathāgata declare that one should not renounce the world without the permission of one’s parents.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sa tān āha utpādayata yūyaṃ kumārakāḥ anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittam / pratipattyā ca saṃpādayata,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Vimalakīrti answered, ‘Young men, you should cultivate yourselves intensively to conceive the spirit of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: saiva yuṣmākaṃ bhaviṣyati pravrajyā sopasaṃpat /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: That in itself will be your renunciation and high ordination!’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tatra dvātriṃśatā licchavikumārair anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpāditāni /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Thereupon, thirtytwo of the Licchavi youths conceived the spirit of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Therefore, Lord, I am reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma gaccha tvam ānanda vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha then said to the venerable Ānanda, “Ānanda, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ānanda āha nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Ānanda replied, “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tatra ca kṣīreṇa kṛtyam āsīt / so 'ham anyatamasmin brāhmaṇamahāśālasya gṛhamūle pātraṃ gṛhītvā sthitaḥ / vimalakīrtir licchavis taṃ pradeśam anuprāptaḥ / sa māṃ vanditvaivam āha Vkn  kiṃ bhadantānanda kālyam eva pātram ādāyāsmin gṛhadvārasamīpe tiṣṭhasi /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Lord, I remember one day when the body of the Lord manifested some indisposition and he required some milk I took the bowl and went to the door of the mansion of a great brahmin family. The Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there, and, having saluted me, said, ‘Reverend Ānanda, what are you doing on the threshold of this house with your bowl in your hand so early in the morning?’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tam enam aham etad avocam bhagavato gṛhapate kāyasya kaścid evābādhaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “I replied, ‘The body of the Lord manifests some indisposition, and he needs some milk.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tat paryeṣāmi /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Therefore, I have come to fetch some.’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sa mām evam āha alaṃ bhadantānanda mā evaṃ vocaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Vimalakīrti then said to me, ‘Reverend Ānanda, do not say such a thing!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: vajrasaṃhatano hi bhadantānanda tathāgatakāyaḥ sarvākuśalavāsanāprahīṇaḥ sarvamahaujaskakuśaladharmasamanvāgataḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Reverend Ānanda, the body of the Tathāgata is tough as a diamond, having eliminated all the instinctual traces of evil and being endowed with all goodness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: kutas tasya vyādhiḥ kuta upadravaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: How could disease or discomfort affect such a body?

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tūṣṇīṃbhūto bhadantānanda gaccha / mā bhagavantam abhyācakṣva /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Reverend Ānanda, go in silence, and do not belittle the Lord.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: mā kasyacid bhūya evaṃ vocaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Do not say such things to others.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: mā mahaujaskā devaputrā anyabuddhakṣetrasaṃnipatitāś ca bodhisatvāḥ śroṣyanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It would not be good for the powerful gods or for the bodhisattvas coming from the various buddhafields to hear such words.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: rājñas tāvad bhadantānanda cakravartina itvarakuśalamūlasamanvāgatasya vyādhir na saṃvidyate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Reverend Ānanda, a universal monarch, who is endowed only with a small root of virtue, is free of diseases.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: kutas tasya bhagavato 'pramāṇakuśalasamanvāgatasya vyādhir bhaviṣyati /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: How then could the Lord, who has an infinite root of virtue, have any disease?

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is impossible.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: gaccha gaccha bhadantānanda / mā mām adhyapatrāpaya, mā anyatīrthikacarakaparivrājakanigranthājīvāḥ śroṣyanti,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Reverend Ānanda, do not bring shame upon us, but go in silence, lest the outsider sectarians should hear your words.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: mā teṣām evaṃ bhaviṣyati /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: They would say, “For shame!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: kīdṛśo bata ayam eṣāṃ śāstā yaḥ svayam eva tāvad ātmānaṃ glānaṃ na śaknoti paritrātum,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The teacher of these people cannot even cure his own sicknesses.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tataḥ pracchannaṃ bhadantānanda gaccha śīghram / mā kaścic chṛṇuyāt /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: How then can he cure the sicknesses of others?” Reverend Ānanda, go then discreetly so that no one observes you.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  api tu bhadantānanda dharmakāyās tathāgatā nāmiṣakāyāḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Reverend Ānanda, the tathāgatas have the body of the Dharmanot a body that is sustained by material food.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: lokottarakāyās tathāgatāḥ sarvalokadharmasamatikrāntāḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The tathāgatas have a transcendental body that has transcended all mundane qualities.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: anābādhas tathāgatasya kāyaḥ sarvāsravavinivṛtaḥ / asaṃskṛtas tathāgatasya kāyaḥ sarvasaṃkhyāvigataḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: There is no injury to the body of a tathāgata, as it is rid of all defilements. The body of a tathāgata is uncompounded and free of all formative activity.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasya bhadanto vyādhim icchatīty ayuktam asadṛśam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Reverend Ānanda, to believe there can be illness in such a body is irrational and unseemly!’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tasya me bhagavan mahadapatrāpyaṃ jātam / mā me bhagavato 'ntikād duḥśrutaṃ durgṛhītaṃ vā kṛtam iti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “When I had heard these words, I wondered if I had previously misheard and misunderstood the Buddha, and I was very much ashamed.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: so 'ham antarīkṣāc chabdam aśrauṣam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Then I heard a voice from the sky

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: evam etad ānanda yathā gṛhapatir nirdiśati /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: ‘Ānanda! The householder speaks to you truly.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: atha ca punaḥ pañcakaṣāye bhagavān utpannaḥ, tenānarthalūhadaridracaryayā satvā vinetavyāḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Nevertheless, since the Buddha has appeared during the time of the five corruptions, he disciplines living beings by acting lowly and humble.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tad gaccha tvam ānanda kṣīraṃ gṛhītvā, mā paryapatrapaś ceti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Therefore, Ānanda, do not be ashamed, and go and get the milk!’

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  īdṛśā bhagavan vimalakīrter licchaveḥ praśnavyākaraṇanirdeśāḥ / tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya kulaputrasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Lord, such was my conversation with the Licchavi Vimalakīrti, and therefore I am reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  evaṃ tāni pañcamātrāṇi śrāvakaśatāny anutsahamānāni bhagavate nivedayanti / ye ca tair vimalakīrtinā licchavinā sārdhaṃ kathāsaṃlāpāḥ kṛtās tān sarvān bhagavate nivedayanti sma /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: In the same way, the rest of the five hundred disciples were reluctant to go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti, and each told the Buddha his own adventure, recounting all his conversations with the Licchavi Vimalakīrti.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tatra bhagavān maitreyaṃ bodhisatvam āmantrayate sma gaccha tvaṃ maitreya vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha then said to the bodhisattva Maitreya, “Maitreya, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: maitreyo 'py āha nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Maitreya replied, “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: abhijānāmy ahaṃ bhagavan ekasmin samaye saṃtuṣitena devaputreṇa sārdhaṃ tuṣitakāyikaiś ca devaputraiḥ sārdhaṃ dharmyāṃ kathāṃ kathayāmi yad idaṃ bodhisatvānāṃ mahāsatvānām avivartyāṃ bhūmim ārabhya /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Lord, I remember that one day I was engaged in a conversation with the gods of the Tuṣita heaven, the god Saṃtuṣita and his retinue, about the stage of nonregression of the great bodhisattvas.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tatra ca vimalakīrtir licchavis taṃ pradeśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ / sa mām etad avocata
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: At that time, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and addressed me as follows

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tvaṃ maitreya ekajātipratibaddho bhagavatā vyākṛto 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Maitreya, the Buddha has prophesied that only one more birth stands between you and unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tat katamayāsi maitreya jātyāu vyākṛtaḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: What kind of birth does this prophecy concern, Maitreya?

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: kim atītayā vānāgatayota pratyutpannayā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Is it past? Is it future? Or is it present?

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tatra yātītā jātiḥ sā kṣīṇā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: If it is a past birth, it is already finished.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yāpy anāgatā sāpy asaṃprāptā, pratyutpannāyāḥ sthitir nāsti jāteḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: If it is a future birth, it will never arrive. If it is a present birth, it does not abide.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yathoktaṃ bhagavatā tathā hi tvaṃ bhikṣaḥ kṣaṇe kṣaṇe jāyase jīryasi mriyase cyavase upapadyase ceti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: For the Buddha has declared, “Bhikṣus, in a single moment, you are born, you age, you die, you transmigrate, and you are reborn.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ajātitaś ca niyāmāvakrāntiḥ / na cājātir vyākriyate / nāpy ajātir abhisaṃbudhyate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: But birthlessness applies to the stage of destiny for the ultimate, in which there is neither prophecy nor attainment of perfect enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tat kathaṃ tvaṃ maitreya vyākṛtas tathatotpādena tathatānirodhena vā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Therefore, Maitreya, is your reality from birth? Or is it from cessation?

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: na ca tathatotpadyate na nirudhyate, na nirotsyate / yā ca sarvasatvānāṃ tathatā, yā ca sarvadharmāṇāṃ tathatā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Your reality as prophesied is not born and does not cease, nor will it be born nor will it cease. Furthermore, your reality is just the same as the reality of all living beings, the reality of all things, and the reality of all the holy ones.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: evaṃ yadi tvaṃ vyākṛtaḥ sarvasatvā api vyākṛtā bhavanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: If your enlightenment can be prophesied in such a way, so can that of all living beings.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: na hi tathatā dvayaprabhāvitā nānātvaprabhāvitā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Because reality does not consist of duality or of diversity.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tad yadā maitreyo bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate, sarvasatvā api tasmin samaye tādṛśīm eva bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Maitreya, whenever you attain buddhahood, which is the perfection of enlightenment, at the same time all living beings will also attain buddhahood.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sarvasatvānubodho hi bodhiḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment consists of the realizations of all living beings.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: yadā ca maitreyaḥ parinirvāsyati, sarvasatvā api tadā parinirvāsyanti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Maitreya, at the moment when you attain ultimate liberation, all living beings will also attain ultimate liberation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: na hy aparinirvṛtānāṃ sarvasatvānāṃ tathāgatāḥ parinirvānti /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The tathāgatas do not enter ultimate liberation until all living beings have entered ultimate liberation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: parinirvṛtāni te satvāni paśyanti nirvāṇaprakṛtikāni /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: For, since all living beings are utterly liberated, the tathāgatas see them as having the nature of ultimate liberation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tasmād iha maitreya mā etān devaputrān ullāpaya mā visaṃvādaya /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Therefore, Maitreya, do not fool and delude these deities!

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  na bodhau kaścit pratiṣṭhate, na nivartate /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: No one abides in, or regresses from, enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: api tu khalu punar maitreya yaiṣāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ bodhiparikalpanadṛṣṭis tām etām utsarjaya /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Maitreya, you should introduce these deities to the repudiation of all discriminative constructions concerning enlightenment.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: na hi bodhiḥ kāyenābhisaṃbudhyate, na cittena /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Enlightenment is perfectly realized neither by the body nor by the mind.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: vyupaśamo bodhiḥ sarvanimittānām,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is the eradication of all marks.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: asamāropo bodhiḥ sarvārambaṇānām, apracāro bodhiḥ sarvamanaskārāṇām,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is free of presumptions concerning all objects. Enlightenment is free of the functioning of all intentional thoughts.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: paricchedo bodhiḥ sarvadṛṣṭigatānām, vigamo bodhiḥ sarvaparikalpānām, visaṃyogo bodhiḥ sarveñjitamanyasyanditānām,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is the annihilation of all convictions. Enlightenment is free from all discriminative constructions. Enlightenment is free from all vacillation, mentation, and agitation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: anadhiṣṭhānaṃ bodhiḥ sarvapraṇidhānānām, asaṅgapraveśo bodhiḥ sarvodgrahavigatā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is not involved in any commitments. Enlightenment is the arrival at detachment, through freedom from all habitual attitudes.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sthitā bodhir dharmadhātusthāne, anugatā bodhis tathatāyām, pratiṣṭhitā bodhir bhūtakoṭyām,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The ground of enlightenment is the ultimate realm. Enlightenment is realization of reality. Enlightenment abides at the realitylimit.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: advayā bodhir manodharmavigatā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is without duality, since therein are no minds and no things.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: samā bodhir ākāśasamatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is equality, since it is equal to infinite space.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: asaṃskṛtā bodhir utpādabhaṅgasthityanyathātvavigatā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘Enlightenment is unconstructed, because it is neither born nor destroyed, neither abides nor undergoes any transformation.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: parijñā bodhiḥ sarvasatvacittacaritāśayānām,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is the complete knowledge of the thoughts, deeds, and inclinations of all living beings.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: advārā bodhir āyatanānām,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is not a door for the sensemedia.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: asaṃsṛṣṭā bodhiḥ sarvavāsanānusaṃdhikleśavigatā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is unadulterated, since it is free of the afflictions of the instinctually driven succession of lives.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: na deśasthā na pradeśasthā bodhiḥ sthānāsthānavigatā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is neither somewhere nor nowhere, abiding in no location or dimension.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tathatāpratiṣṭhitā bodhiḥ sarvato 'dṛśyā /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment, not being contained in anything, does not stand in reality.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: nāmadheyamātraṃ bodhis tac ca nāma nirīhakam,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is merely a name and even that name is motionless.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: nirātmikā bodhir āyūhaniryūhavigatā, anākulā bodhiḥ prakṛtipariśuddhā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment, free of abstention and undertaking, is energyless. There is no agitation in enlightenment, as it is utterly pure by nature.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: prakāśā bodhiḥ svabhāvapariśuddhā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is radiance, pure in essence.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: anudgrahā bodhir adhyālambanavigatā, nirnānātvā bodhiḥ sarvadharmasamatāvabodhatvāt,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is without subjectivity and completely without object. Enlightenment, which penetrates the equality of all things, is undifferentiated.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: anupamā bodhir upamopanyāsavigatāḥ,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment, which is not shown by any example, is incomparable.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sūkṣmā bodhir duranubodhatvāt,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is subtle, since it is extremely difficult to realize.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sarvatrānugatā bodhir ākāśasvabhāvatvāt /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment is allpervasive, as it has the nature of infinite space.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sā na śakyā kāyena vācā cittenābhisaṃboddhum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Enlightenment cannot be realized, either physically or mentally.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  iha bhagavan nirdeśe nirdiśyamāne tataḥ pariṣado dvayor devaputraśatayor anutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntipratilambho 'bhūt /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “Lord, when Vimalakīrti had discoursed thus, two hundred of the deities in that assembly attained the tolerance of the birthlessness of things.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ahaṃ ca niṣpratibhāno 'bhūvam /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: As for me, Lord, I was rendered speechless.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Therefore, I am reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  tatra bhagavān prabhāvyūhaṃ licchavikumāram āmantrayate sma gaccha tvaṃ satpuruṣa vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: The Buddha then said to the young Licchavi Prabhāvyūha, “Prabhāvyūha, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: prabhāvyūho 'py āha nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Prabhāvyūha replied, “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: ekasmin samaye bhagavan vaiśālyā mahānagaryā niṣkramāmi / vimalakīrtiś ca licchaviḥ praviśati /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: Lord, I remember one day, when I was going out of the great city of Vaiśālī, I met the Licchavi Vimalakīrti coming in.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: so 'haṃ tam abhivādyaivam avocam
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: He greeted me, and I then addressed him

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: kutas tvaṃ gṛhapate āgacchasīti / sa mām evam āha āgacchāmi bodhimaṇḍād iti / tam aham etad avocam bodhimaṇḍa iti kasyaitan nāma /
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: ‘Householder, where do you come from?’ He replied, ‘I come from the seat of enlightenment.’ I then inquired, ‘What is meant by “seat of enlightenment”?’ He then spoke the following words to me

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  bodhimaṇḍa iti kulaputra āśayamaṇḍa eṣo 'kṛtrimatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: ‘Noble son, the seat of enlightenment is the seat of positive thought because it is without artificiality.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: prayogamaṇḍa eṣa ārambhottāraṇatayā, adhyāśayamaṇḍa eṣa viśeṣādhigamatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of effort, because it releases energetic activities. It is the seat of high resolve, because its insight is superior.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: bodhicittamaṇḍa eṣo 'saṃpramoṣanatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of the great spirit of enlightenment, because it does not neglect anything.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  dānamaṇḍa eṣa vipākāpratikāṅkṣaṇatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘It is the seat of generosity, because it has no expectation of reward.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: śīlamaṇḍa eṣa praṇidhānaparipūraṇatayā, kṣāntimaṇḍa eṣa sarvasatvāpratihatacittatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of morality, because it fulfills all commitments. It is the seat of tolerance, because it is free of anger toward any living being.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: vīryamaṇḍa eṣo 'vinivartanatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of effort, because it does not turn back.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: dhyānamaṇḍa eṣa cittakarmaṇyatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of meditation, because it generates fitness of mind.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: prajñāmaṇḍa eṣa pratyakṣadarśitayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of wisdom, because it sees everything directly.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  maitrīmaṇḍa eṣa sarvasatvasamacittatayā, karuṇāmaṇḍa eṣa khedasahiṣṇutayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘It is the seat of love, because it is equal to all living beings. It is the seat of compassion, because it tolerates all injuries.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: muditāmaṇḍa eṣa dharmārāmaratiratatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of joy, because it is joyfully devoted to the bliss of the Dharma.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: upekṣāmaṇḍa eṣo 'nunayapratighaprahāṇatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of equanimity, because it abandons affection and aversion.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  abhijñāmaṇḍa eṣa ṣaḍabhijñatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘It is the seat of paranormal perception, because it has the six superknowledges.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: vimokṣamaṇḍa eṣo 'kalpanatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of liberation, because it does not intellectualize.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: upāyamaṇḍa eṣa satvaparipācanatayā, saṃgrahavastumaṇḍa eṣa sarvasatvasaṃgrahanatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of liberative art, because it develops living beings. It is the seat of the means of unification, because it brings together living beings.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: śrutamaṇḍa eṣa pratipattisārakatvāt,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of learning, because it makes practice of the essence.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: nidhyaptimaṇḍa eṣa yoniśaḥpratyavekṣaṇatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of decisiveness, because of its precise discrimination.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: bodhipakṣyadharmamaṇḍa eṣa saṃskṛtāsaṃskṛtotsarjanatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of the aids to enlightenment, because it eliminates the duality of the compounded and the uncompounded.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: satyamaṇḍa eṣa sarvalokāvisaṃvādanatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of truth, because it does not deceive anyone.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: pratītyasamutpādamaṇḍa eṣo 'vidyāsravakṣayatayā yāvaj jarāmaraṇāsravakṣayatayā, sarvakleśapraśamanamaṇḍa eṣa yathābhūtābhisaṃbodhanatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘It is the seat of interdependent origination, because it proceeds from the exhaustion of ignorance to the exhaustion of old age and death. It is the seat of eradication of all afflictions, because it is perfectly enlightened about the nature of reality.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: Vkn  sarvasatvamaṇḍa eṣa satvāsvabhāvatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of all living beings, because all living beings are without intrinsic identity.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sarvadharmamaṇḍa eṣa śūnyatābhisaṃbodhanatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of all things, because it is perfectly enlightened with regard to voidness.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: sarvamāranirghātanamaṇḍa eso 'calanatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: “ ‘It is the seat of the conquest of all devils, because it never flinches.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: traidhātukamaṇḍa eṣa prasthānavigamanatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of the triple world, because it is free of involvement.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: siṃhanādanadanavīryamaṇḍa eṣo 'bhītānutrāsanatayā,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of the heroism that sounds the lion’s roar, because it is free of fear and trembling.

Vimalakīrtinirdeśa: balavaiśāradyāveṇikasarvabuddhadharmamaṇḍa esa sarvato 'nupākruṣṭatvāt,
The Teaching of Vimalakīrti: It is the seat of the strengths, the fearlessnesses, and all the special qualities of the Buddha, because it is irreproachable in all respects.
